Documentation Tester

This file is a simple test to describe the different documenting options available with lk.Doc. This first paragraph is output as "summary".

The following paragraphs up to the end of the preamble comment block define the "description".

A second paragraph in the "description" with an auto link: doc.DocTest. And here is a custom link "lubyk":http://lubyk.org. And some formatting: strong emphasis.

Some lists:

  • foo
  • bar
  • baz

Finally, some inline math \(\infty\) with more text. And now some more math in its own paragraph:

\(\frac{\partial}{\partial\theta_j}J(\theta) = \frac{1}{m}\sum_{i=1}^m(\theta^{T}x^{(i)}-y^{(i)})x_j^{(i)}\)

And some more text after math. With an image (the path is relative to the output directory).

Create

.new (params)

Creating an lk.DocTest is done by providing a table of parameters.

Usage example:

require 'lubyk'
local doc = lk.Doc('path/to/File.lua', {target = 'doc'})
lk.writeall('doc/File.html', doc:toHtml())

When documenting multiple files it is better to use make.

.make (def)

Generate the documentation for multiple files.

The sources parameter lists file paths to Lua files parse and document. The target parameter is the path to the directory where all the output files will be written. format is the type of output desired. Possible values are "html" or "latex".

TODO an example of a todo inside the comments.

Usage:

require 'lubyk'
lk.Doc.make {
  sources = {
    'lib/doc/DocTest.lua',
    'lib/doc/Other.lua',
  },
  target = 'doc',
  format = 'html',
}

Parameters

This is to test parsing table attributes.

.cost1 = {default = 0.5, min = 0, max = 1, unit = 'CHF'}

This is a first attribute that is used for this or that.

$$\infty$$

.cost2 = {default = 5, min = 0, max = 10, unit = '$'}

A second attribute.

Foobar

With some text about the Foobar group of parameters.

.foo = 4

An attribute in the foobar group.

.bar = 'some text here'

Another attribute in the foobar group.

Validation

This is a long description of the new validation section. We can write tons of text here as long as we do not get out of the Lua comments.

Sub-title

A second paragraph describing the section.

FIXME Something to do for validations.

:isOK ()

Return true if all the documentation went fine. Possible causes of failure are: bad file format, missing assets.

String management

This group of functions blah, blah.

:append (str)

Append the str string to the description.

:outOfFile (one, two)

This definition documents an out of file function. This function takes a one and two and makes something interesting with these two parameters.

With a second paragraph to describe the out of file function.

Multi line comment

We can also use a multi-line comment block to define a section with many paragraphs.

Like this a second piece of text with bold.

:complicated (alpha, beta, gamma)

A long description for a very complex function, blah and this and that. In order to help people understand all the details for something very complex.

Second paragraph before the function.
